source.41ac5849:
#word cloud
from wordcloud import WordCloud, ImageColorGenerator
text = " ".join(str(each) for each in df.key_ratios)
# Create and generate a word cloud image:
wordcloud = WordCloud(max_words=200,colormap='Set3', background_color="black").generate(text)
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.figure(figsize=(15,10))
# Display the generated image:
plt.imshow(wordcloud, interpolation='Bilinear')
plt.axis("off")
plt.figure(1,figsize=(12, 12))
plt.show()
source.7e8c6585:
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder

#fill in mean for floats
for c in df.columns:
    if df[c].dtype=='float16' or  df[c].dtype=='float32' or  df[c].dtype=='float64':
        df[c].fillna(df[c].mean())

#fill in -999 for categoricals
df = df.fillna(-999)
# Label Encoding
for f in df.columns:
    if df[f].dtype=='object': 
        lbl = LabelEncoder()
        lbl.fit(list(df[f].values))
        df[f] = lbl.transform(list(df[f].values))
        
print('Labelling done.')

#Codes by Tawej https://www.kaggle.com/tawejssh/covid-19

plt.figure(figsize=(20,7))
plt.plot(ratio['ratios_2011_09'], label='ratios_2011_09')
plt.plot(ratio['ratios_2012_09'], label='ratios_2012_09')
plt.plot(ratio['ratios_2013_09'], label='ratios_2013_09')
plt.plot(ratio['ratios_2014_09'], label='ratios_2014_09')
plt.plot(ratio['ratios_2015_09'], label='ratios_2015_09')
plt.plot(ratio['ratios_2016_09'], label='ratios_2016_09')
plt.legend()
#plt.grid()
plt.title('Key Ratios 2011 - 2016')
plt.xticks(ratio.index,rotation=45)
plt.xlabel('Key Ratios')
plt.ylabel('Count')
plt.show()

source.0d46465b:
Apple's years under Tim Cook

"When Steve Jobs stepped down from his role as Apple CEO on August 24, 2011, he stated his belief that "Apple's brightest and most innovative days are ahead of it," a notion that many Apple enthusiasts and admirers of Jobs' life's work did not share at the time. While his successor Tim Cook was widely respected as an efficient COO and supply chain expert, many onlookers thought he lacked the vision and charisma to follow in the footsteps left by his larger-than-life predecessor." "Yet, ten years into Cook's tenure at the helm of Apple, it must be concluded that Jobs was at least partly right. Apple's revenue and profit more than tripled between 2011 and 2021, as the company constantly expanded the ecosystem of devices and services around its flagship product, the iPhone." "Under Cook's leadership, Apple outperformed the broader market more than 3 to 1 over the past ten years, as the company's share price increased by more than 1,000 percent." https://www.statista.com/chart/25610/apple-growth-under-tim-cook/?utm_source=Statista+Newsletters&utm_campaign=b4a4d299d4-All_InfographTicker_daily_COM_AM_KW29_2021_Mo_COPY&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_662f7ed75e-b4a4d299d4-315801217

source.1bcbf9ca:
#Trailing 12 months (TTM):  

"It's the term for the data from the past 12 consecutive months used for reporting financial figures. A company's trailing 12 months represent its financial performance for a 12-month period; it does not typically represent a fiscal-year ending period."

https://www.investopedia.com/terms/t/ttm.asp#:~:text=Trailing%2012%20months%20(TTM)%20is%20the%20term%20for%20the%20data,a%20fiscal%2Dyear%20ending%20period.
source.18ba9697: #To avoid a certain clumsy visualization here I separated 2011 till 2016
source.7a4a348d:
Who is Better As a CEO? Steve vs Tim


Steve Jobs vs. Tim Cook: Who is Better As a CEO of Apple? Author: JIGNESH - JUNE 15, 2021 "Every year Apple hosts events to release its products and software. The events become a dynamic session for Apple to convey its ideas, innovations, and strategies towards its products & services. Earlier the events were anchored by co-founder, chairman and CEO Steve Jobs, and post his death; Tim Cook took the reins in his hands." "There are several arguments in favor and against both CEOs, who have done the excellent job; in fact, Tim Cook is holding the position with much appreciation from the employees of Apple." Product Innovation, Marketing Strategy and Customer Satisfaction: This is Apple. "With Cook, Apple began to upgrade the existing product line instead of releasing revolutionary products." "Tim Cook looks calm and composed, and this posture has shifted the company to gentler." "Cook became the change agent in marketing & cost-cutting strategies. With his experience at IBM, where he expedited supply chain management, Cook introduced some drastic changes in integrated marketing, product design, and manufacturing in Apple. His idea was to offer “simple solutions to complex problems” and to make it possible, he launched grand marketing campaigns, colossal engineering feats, and cost-saving methods." https://www.igeeksblog.com/steve-jobs-vs-tim-cook/
